Development Progress & Timeline

Over the last couple of months we've been busy refining Companion Quest. As we mentioned in our last update, we sent out over 50 copies of the game and many people that covered it were kind enough to send us feedback or share their critical thoughts via a review. This is in addition to the many playtests we conducted. Here's what we've been working on these last few months:

Game Difficulty
The number one piece of feedback we received from players was that the game is quite challenging. This was sometimes positive or negative depending on the player. We decided to leave the "normal difficulty" unchanged but have since been focused on providing streamlined rulesets for Easy and Hard modes so that players can customize the experience to their preferred difficulty. 

Game Balance 
A trend we noticed amongst playthroughs and from playtester feedback was that the game was harder at lower player counts and easier and higher player counts. We have made several small tweaks to the game to balance the difficulty of the game so that the game provides a similar challenge regardless of player count.

Fine Tuning Companion & Gnome Effects
Ensuring that the effects players can activate are fun! Whilst we want a balanced game, we also want one that is focused on fun so that players can pull off crazy combos and create memorable moments! We reviewed all abilities and made sure they were balanced but still kept their fun factor!

Game development is set to conclude at the end of March, in just one weeks time. With our commitment of having Companion Quest in your hands by this December, we're keeping up the pace to ensure we meet this commitment. More on the production timeline in the next update!

Portal Problem Puzzle #4: One Big Problem - Easy
In One Big Problem, you have a lot of dice showing #1 - go figure! This presents a problem, Unstable Portal says that is cannot have dice of the same number placed on it. Ensure you use your companions wisely to manipulate the dice and overcome this problem!

content.content:
Welcome adventurers, in this update you‚Äôll find: 

- An Expansion Deep Dive
- Portal Problem Puzzle #3

Expansion Deep Dive
The Wild Expansion - In this expansion, you may find a Wild die! This die is capable of being used as any other color, making it a powerful resource. However, in order to find the wild die you will need to find a Wild Card or tame a Wild Companion!

The Legendary Expansion - In this expansion, you may find and tame Legendary Companions. These companions are particularly useful not only because of their unique and powerful abilities but they also ready up when you place a certain number instead of color. Which allows you to potentially ready up two Companions with one die placement. 

For example, I place a yellow #5 die, I have a Legendary Companion that readies up when a #5 die is placed and a regular Companion that readies up when a yellow die is placed. Therefore, you can ready up two Companions with one die placement. 
Regular Companions that have the ability to turn dice to a certain number compliment Legendary Companions very well!

Portal Problem Puzzle #3: Pesky Problems - Medium
In Pesky Problems, you can deduce which dice must be placed on which danger card due to the color restrictions they have. The difficulty of this puzzle is getting the dice numbers high enough to meet or exceed the dangers health totals and defeat them. You must place your dice in the right order to take out the dangers.  
Pesky Problems - Medium

content.content:
Welcome adventurers, in this update you‚Äôll find: 

- A Replayability Deep Dive
- Rules for Solo Play
- Gnome Background #2 - Bubbles

Replayability Deep Dive
Companion Quest comes with a ton of cards! More than you will use in each game, which allows each playthrough to feel exciting and different each time you play. Outlined below are some of the highlights from a replayability stand point. 
 
- 57 Starting & Wild Companion Cards, 5-20 used per game depending on player count.
48 of the 57 Companions cards have unique abilities, there are not many duplicate abilities in the deck, making it exciting to discover new companions and the strategies they allow.

- 28 Portal Problem Cards. (20 Challenges, 10 used per game. 8 Dangers, 2 used per game)
All unique cards with varied dice requirements requirements and dice placement rules modifier.

- 12 Quest Cards, 4 used per game.
Each quest has a unique game changing rules modifier, dice requirements and detailed art.

- 7 Gnome Cards, 1-4 used per game depending on player count.
Each come with a unique, once per game ability and unique starting companion.

In addition to the cards that come in the game, Companion Quest will come with an easy and hard setting so you can customize the experience depending on who you're playing with or the level of challenge you want. 
 

Rules for Solo Play
Below you'll find an excerpt from the rulebook outlining how to play Companion Quest solo.
To summarize, you gain 1 additional snack token, can use your gnome ability on yourself, and keep one unused die to carry over to your next turn! As well as gaining some extra rewards along the way too! It's that easy!

Gameplay Spotlight
We would like to share with you some examples from the draft version of the rulebook about how Companion Quest plays. Below you will find an example turn about some of the choices you can make during play. 
While this example turn shows the basics of how a turn could play out, one of the most fun and exciting aspects of Companion Quest is Resting Companions (to use their ability) and having them Ready Up (so their abilities can be used again). 

As seen in the example below when you place a die onto any Quest or Portal Problem card you Ready Up a Companion with a matching color, if you have any. You can begin to combo multiple uses of your Companions on a single turn as they change your rolls to the results you need!
If you would like to learn more about how the game plays, please check out this amazing How to Play video from A Dicey Review.
Portal Problem Puzzle #1: Contraption Distraction - Easy
Introducing..... Portal Problem Puzzles, these mini games are a great way to learn Companion Quest, and solve small challenging puzzles using components found in the core game. 
Contraption Distraction - Easy
Your task is to complete Pressure Plates and Malfunctioning Machine using the dice shown above with Mumbles the gnome, and Snaps and Luna the companions helping you along the way. 

If you would like to try and solve this puzzle, you can find it setup in Tabletop Simulator to try right now! Please let us know how you went in the comments section. 

If you want to see an example of how to complete this puzzle or you're having trouble solving it, watch the video below to see one of the possible solutions to this puzzle.
Tabletop Simulator Instructions
To try the Portal Problem Puzzle or play Companion Quest digitally, please follow the instructions below:

1. Click on this link: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3025474584
2. Press the green "Subscribe" button.
3. Open your Steam program.
4. Launch Tabletop Simulator.
5. Press "Create" then "Singleplayer" (if you're playing solo) OR "Multiplayer" (if you're playing with others)
6. Press "Companion Quest" next to the "Workshop" icon then "Load".
7. Enjoy playing Companion Quest!

That's all from us today, happy puzzling! 

- The Ghostfire Gaming Team

Components & Color Limited Vision Information
We would like to take some time to ensure anyone who has color limited vision, that this game will be fully accessible to you. With so many colored components and icons, we‚Äôre paying close attention to this aspect of the game and making sure Companion Quest is accessible to all players. We are actively working with individuals that have color limited vision to ensure that the final game is accessible to them.
Please note that the prototype copies you‚Äôve seen on Youtube videos are all pre-production and the dice colors and icons are not reflective of the exact colors that will be used in the final version of the game. In particular, we are aware of the closeness of the orange and yellow dice in this current version and are working to have them easily distinguished from one another.
Stibbles McScooples is the ultimate adventurer, who spends his time between quests cataloging all the strange creatures he comes across. In his nearly 200 years of life, Stibbles has been through it all; fighting demigods, becoming a werewolf, stealing from kings, ruling over rats, and even dying! Thanks to Gu‚ÄôGu‚Äôs time portals, he survived that last one without a scratch. Now he‚Äôs back, with his best friend Stibbles Jr. the little treant, to help save the world again!
    He‚Äôs the fourth of his twelve siblings, who all grew up tending stables in a little gnome village in the woods. Each of them eventually left home in their own time, but Stibbles was the first! His thirst for adventure eventually brought him to a magical pet shop, where his shenanigans led to the rampage Gu‚ÄôGu has begun. With his knack for finding friends in unlikely places, his companions are the key to setting things right.
